subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Call of	 Cthulhu: Typo Report: ¶6, ¶7	; more name-dot confusion
msgSnippet: ... Mine either, I assure you.  It makes me wonder if I over-lengthen long vowels in Italian (phonetic) or Finnish (phonemic): probably. ... Well, sure, just
messageBody:
BPJ scripsit:

> That said my L1 certainly doesn't poise me to perceive length
> distinctions in fully unstressed vowels!

Mine either, I assure you. It makes me wonder if I over-lengthen long
vowels in Italian (phonetic) or Finnish (phonemic): probably.

> LPD advises EFL learners to use that distribution, but warns that
> native speakers sometimes use [t@] before vowels

Well, sure, just as written "an apple" is sometimes articulated /@æpl/,
particularly in /@eIvi.i/.

--
John Cowan <cowan@...>
Yakka foob mog. Grug pubbawup zink wattoom gazork. Chumble spuzz.
--Calvin, giving Newton's First Law "in his own words"
